articles.title: We are going to get 65% of votes - Malema in his hometown of Seshego - News24
articles.description: "We are going to get 65 percent in the whole of Polokwane and in the whole of South Africa," said Economic Freedom Fighters leader Julius Malema in his hometown of Seshego in Limpopo on Monday.
articles.content:
• EFF leader Julius Malema cast his vote in his hometown of Seshego on Monday.
  • He said he believed the EFF would dominate results there, but also in the rest of the country.

articles.title: Guinea strongman Doumbouya retires 1,000 soldiers | The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News — World - Guardian
articles.description: Guinea's Colonel Mamady Doumbouya, who seized power in a coup in the West African nation in September, has announced that he is placing nearly 1,000 soldiers into retirement.
articles.content:

articles.title: Presiding officer caught stuffing ballot box in eThekwini testament to voting process' safeguards - IEC - News24
articles.description: The arrest of a presiding officer in eThekwini for allegedly stuffing marked ballots into a ballot box, is a "testament to the built-in safeguards of the voting process", the Electoral Commission of South Africa said on Monday.
articles.content:
• The IEC was satisfied that voting got off to a "smooth and timely" start.
